alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 6:34PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Burlington County through 700 PM EDT... At 634 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Laurel, or 9 miles east of Camden, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Laurel, Willingboro, Lumberton, Burlington, Bristol, Mount Holly, Riverside, Beverly, Pemberton, Ramblewood, Marlton, Jacksonville, Cherry Hill Mall, Maple Shade, Cinnaminson, Edgewater Park, Moorestown-Lenola and Nws Office. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 4 and 5. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 37 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
